Reviews.Title: what a deal!
Reviews.Author: Matias P.
Reviews.Content: Super fast, sleek looking (Apple "inspired"), instant on, very responsive screen. I cannot find anything wrong with this machine. I've got it refurbished but looks like new and it saved me a few hundred dollars.I've had Acers for years and they continue to impress me.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: John Campbell "MrLightRail"
Reviews.Content: Decided to go with a full touchscreen laptop, now that Windows 8 is out there, and I went with this unit for the same money a 11'' Acer was selling for at Wal-Mart, but this one had the larger screen, Intel processor, and a optical drive. Added two gigs of memory to bring it to 8 gigs, which is the maximum for this machine. Would have loved to have 12 gigs. Unit did not come with a SSD drive, and it is difficult to swap drives in this laptop. I've always had easy access to the hard drive in all of my previous laptops, but this one is a BIG exception.I've had no gripes about the unit, other than the HDD expansion/swap issue until I upgraded the OS to Windows 8.1. From then on, I could never keep a stable wifi connection. I've heard that changing your router to only support 20ghz wifi will fix the drops, and so far it has, but there needs to be a fix so I can use the full capabilities of my router.I don't use the trackpad on this unit, as my palm causes inadvertent mouse clicks constantly. Really not too much of an inconvenience, since I use the touchscreen for most of my usage. But, if I want to type, I disable it first. (like now).Overall, this is a great machine for the money. If you do decide to get it, order the extra two megs of memory. It does make a difference in overall performance.

Reviews.Title: speedy little laptop
Reviews.Author: David O'Dell Petersen
Reviews.Content: Quick.  Only problem is windows 8.. which I'm just gonna have to get used to- the touchscreen technology makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Tee
Reviews.Content: So far so good. The backlit keyboard is nice. Touch screen is very responsive. Laptop is fast. Wifi connects pretty fast. Still learning Windows 8. Capslock and shift key is kind of tricky. But other than that. Great purchase is what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop ever....
Reviews.Author: Stacy Oberbeck
Reviews.Content: For a first time user this laptop is AMAZING!!! The touch screen is so easy to use and windows 8 was a breeze to get used to. I prefer it.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop because its light weight and slim.The keyboard lights up and its very fast (touchscreen).I didn't have any problems with connecting with wifi.

Reviews.Title: Exellent price/quality
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: Exellent quality for a good price.  Touch screen works great and needed for Windows 8 or Windows 8.1. Very good design.

Reviews.Title: Bargain priced, great quality for my home office needs.
Reviews.Author: john mullin, jr
Reviews.Content: Great computer and love the speed on touch screen.  Returned a new $900.00 Dell and saved $400.00 on this one.

Reviews.Title: love the touchscreen!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice laptop for the money. I love using it more than my mac laptop at work. I am very glad I bought it! It seems like it will last for a long time.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy another one.
Reviews.Author: Ike
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to windows 8. But the computer itself is fast and easy to use. Touchscreen.... A must have. I will not ever go back to keyboard and mouse. Does not leave fingerprints on screen. No complaints at all. Well worth the money. Seems very well built.
